revised_title: Ground-based and Viking Satellite Observations of Magnetosphere-Ionosphere Interactions
tldr: This article discusses the coordinated ground-based and Viking satellite observations of the magnetosphere and ionosphere interactions. The observations reveal new insights into the westward-travelling surge, a key feature of substorm expansion. The study also highlights the importance of combining ground-based measurements with satellite data to gain a comprehensive understanding of the complex coupling processes in the magnetosphere and ionosphere.
